com.xhive.query.interfaces
Interface XhiveXQueryQueryIf

public interface XhiveXQueryQueryIf

XhiveXQueryQueryIf represents a parsed query. It can be used to register external functions and set parameter values before execution.

A parsed query can be executed several times with different parameters, functions or on different context nodes. Parameters and functions can be overwritten by setting the same name to a different value.

If the creation document for this query is not set via setCreationDocument(XhiveDocumentIf), any nodes created in the query are created in a temporary document and should not be used after the transaction they are created in is aborted or committed.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 7
See Also:
execute(), XhiveNodeIf.createXQuery(String)

Method Detail

execute

java.util.Iterator<? extends XhiveXQueryValueIf> execute()
Execute this query. All paths are resolved relative to the XhiveNodeIf on which this query was created.

This will not necessarily execute all statements but rather prepare the result as queries are evaluated lazily.

The result values should be cast to XhiveXQueryValueIf

Returns:
an iterator over the result sequence

executeOn

java.util.Iterator<? extends XhiveXQueryValueIf> executeOn(XhiveNodeIf node)
Execute this query. All paths are resolved relative to the given XhiveNodeIf, except for module import paths, which are resolved at the time the query is created.

This will not necessarily execute all statements but rather prepare the result as queries are evaluated lazily.

The result values should be cast to XhiveXQueryValueIf

Parameters:
node - the context node to execute the query on
Returns:
an iterator over the result sequence

setCreationDocument

void setCreationDocument(XhiveDocumentIf doc)
Set the creation document for this query.

Parameters:
doc - The document that will be the owner for all nodes created in the query.

setFunction

void setFunction(java.lang.String localname,
                 XhiveXQueryExtensionFunctionIf function)
Register a function for the given localname. Functions without an explicitly given namespace are placed in the default function namespace, which is http://www.w3.org/2003/05/xpath-functions if not declared otherwise.

In X-Hive/DB external functions do not necessarily have to be declared within the query, though this is recommended for compatibility.

Please keep in mind that functions may or may not be called due to optimizations. In particular the order in which functions are called might be different from what you expect.

Parameters:
localname - the localname of the funtion
function - the function to execute
See Also:
XhiveXQueryExtensionFunctionIf

setFunction

void setFunction(java.lang.String uri,
                 java.lang.String localname,
                 XhiveXQueryExtensionFunctionIf function)
Register a function for the given localname and URI. To use a function within the query that is not in the default namespace, it's namespace has to be bound to a prefix within the query.

In X-Hive/DB external functions do not necessarily have to be declared within the query, though this is recommended for compatibility.

Please keep in mind that functions may or may not be called due to optimizations. In particular the order in which functions are called might be different from what you expect.

Parameters:
uri - namespace URI of the function
localname - the localname of the funtion
function - the function to execute
See Also:
XhiveXQueryExtensionFunctionIf

setVariable

void setVariable(java.lang.String localname,
                 java.util.Iterator sequence)
Bind a value to an external variable. For permissible types of the objects returned by the iterator and the associated XQuery types, see XhiveXQueryExtensionFunctionIf.call(java.util.Iterator[]).

Parameters:
localname - The name of the parameter as declared in the query.
sequence - The value of the parameter.
